_header: A knight there was by old daw lither man enow
_description: The Devil in Service, a miracle of the Virgin, in the South English Legendary — in couplets

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
A Knight þer was bi olde dayes luþer man y nowStrong
                    robber & manguller & to al shrewdenes drow…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…On Marie what it is miche þi milce & þin oreSo
                    merie it is to telle of þe þat ȝet we mote more
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line.

OxfTri57.First Lines:
A knyȝt þer was be olde dayes luþer man y
                    nouȝStrong robbere & manquellere to alle scherewednesse
                    drouȝ…
OxfTri57.Last Lines:
…O marie þat it is so moche þy milce and þyn
                    oreSo merie it is to telle of þe þat ȝut we mote
                    more

CULAdd3039.First Lines:
A knyght it was be olde þat lyfyd il lyfe ynogheStrange robber
                    & mansloer to al schrewdnes he drogheBy a heghe way castel he had fer
                    fro ilka tonneAl þe folk þat come þer forþe he robbed
                    & slogh þaim donne…
CULAdd3039.Last Lines:
…To þat lady I rede we pray þat is of mercy
                    hendeÞat scho kepe vs night & day & schilde vs fro þe
                    fende

CamCCC145.First Lines:
A kniȝt þer was bi olde dawe liþer mon InouStrong
                    robbare & monquellare to alle ssrewehede drou…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…On Marie þat is muche þi swete milce and oreSo muri
                    it is to telle of þe þat ȝute me mote more
CamCCC145.Editions:
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS
         o.s. 235 (1959), 236 (1956); repr. 1967: 229.

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
A kniȝt þer was by olde dawe þat luþer man was
                    ynowStrong robbour and manquellere and to alle luþernesse
                    drow…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…O Marie þat so muche is þi swete mylce & oreSo
                    murye hit is to telle of þe þat ȝut we mote more

CamTCC605.First Lines:
A knyȝt þer was wyle a luþer man ynowea strange
                    robbere & manquellere to al schrewhede he drowe…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…þer for eche cristen man þat wole do by my
                    loregrete oure leuedy eche day & byde hure mylce & ore
CamTCC605.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of Trinity College Cambridge MS R.3.25.
         https://mss-cat.trin.cam.ac.uk/Manuscript/R.3.25.

BLAdd10301.First Lines:
A kniȝt þer was by olde dawe luþer man y nouStrong
                    Robbare & man quellare to al ssrewede he drou…
BLAdd10301.Last Lines:
…On marie þat is Muche þi swete milce & oreSo
                    Murye it is to telle of þe þat ȝut me mote more

BLCottCleoDIX.First Lines:
[A] kniȝt þer was bi olde dawe luþer man
                    inouȝStronge robbar & manquellar to alle schrewhed he
                    droȝ…
BLCottCleoDIX.Last Lines:
…On þe marie þat is moche þi swete milce &
                    oreSo murie hit is to tell of þe þat ȝut we mot
                    more
BLCottCleoDIX.Note:
Folio number reflects the most recent foliation. Space left for enlarged
                    ‘A’, which was left blank.

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: A knyȝt þer was bi olde dawe luþer man ynoustrong robbere & manquellare to al schreueþe he drou…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …on marie þat it is moche þi suete milce & oreso merie hit is to telle of þe þat ȝut we mote more
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum Ciiii” added to left margin by later hand (f. 302); “it” added above line by scribe in penultimate line.
